title: (23300) Villacarrillo -
description: Parking of the hermitage with very good views. We spent the night with another van. Very, very quiet night.

title: (23310) Villacarrillo - 8 Calle las Villas
description: Recreation area in the city of Mogón. Next to the natural pool. There are toilets, water and containers. Supermarket 100 meters and bars. We had a very quiet night.

title: (23338) Iznatoraf - 22 Calle Carretera
description: Shared parking. parking located at the top of the city easy to find. steep access but no problem for a 7 m cc. pretty village. small grocery store nearby with bread.

title: (23330) Villanueva del Arzobispo - 74 Calle Fuensanta
description: Next to Parque San Blas. Green and quiet area. With playground and snack bar (public holidays) something inclined, in town center, bars in street from above.

title: (23330) Villanueva del Arzobispo - 213 Calle Ramón y Cajal
title_short: (23330) Villanueva del Arzobispo - 213 Calle Ramón y Cajal
description:
*** Closed from 7 to 9 September 2023***

Wonderful parking for motorhomes, caravans and campervans in the heart of the Sierra De Cazorla, Segura and Las Villas. Fully adapted to the needs of our customers. Its ideal location for the entrance to the Las Villas Natural Park (300 meters) and exit to the A-32 motorway (50 meters). We started our journey this September with the desire to improve and listen to the wishes of our customers. Access to the car park is easy, but for any questions or concerns - call on tel. A magical place to rest, to be able to explore our mountains and visit the Sanctuary of the Virgen de la Fuensanta. Near the parking lot you can find a bakery, supermarkets and restaurants.

title: (23330) Villanueva del Arzobispo -
description: Parking at the entrance to the sanctuary of FuenSanta. Some shade trees and a fountain. Well in general very nice, but a lot of traffic and constant, from time to time they use the horn, it must be customary... I left because I couldn't rest.

title: (23300) Sierra -
description: Secluded spot outside Mogón. Last 5km is along a gravel road in good condition and passable with all vehicles. Use the road that follows the river out the north-east of Mogón that passes the “Huerta Rubiales”. Other routes are very rough otherwise. Waterfalls are 30-60mins hike further along the trail. Occasional phone signal coverage but not to be relied on.

title: (23300) Sierra - 35 Extrarradio Diseminados
description: Picnic area in the Aguascebas reservoir in the middle of the natural park, equipped with picnic areas, garbage cans and a children's area. Beautiful views of the reservoir. You can park 1 or 2 AC or 2 camper ... the terrain is uneven although some areas are flat. Overnight is not allowed.

title: (23300) Sierra - Unnamed Road
description:
At 890 meters above sea level, in the middle of the Sierra, we have 2 hectares, surrounded by nature. We want to share this place with campers. There are several waterfalls in the area. Vultures fly around and deer regularly roam there.

 Possibility of Clean Water and Emptying of the WC (Vinegar preferably). Accepted animals. children too.

 The maximum stay is 1 week or consult.

 Only for 4x4 motorhomes or small motorhomes

title: (23339) Villanueva del Arzobispo - 1 Calle Cuatro Caminos
title_short: (23339) Villanueva del Arzobispo - 1 Calle Cuatro Caminos
description: Good shady spot for an overnight stop, there is a source of drinking water

title: (23320) Torreperogil -
description: Picnic spot..Drive through.  I did not spend the night. 2 picnic tables at the side of the road.Signposted on approach.Room  for small or large vehicle. Small number of trees for shade.

title: (23270) Gutar - Unnamed Road
description: Roadside picnic area, lots of parking suitable for all size of vehicle

title: (23320) Torreperogil - 13 Calle Salvador Dalí
description: The service area for motorhomes, built next to the Parque de La Mejorana pine forest, is already operational. Located at the confluence of Zurbarán and Antonio Chacón streets, it will allow the deposit of black and gray water from these vehicles. At the gates of the Parque de Cazorla, Segura and Las Villas.

title: (23410) Sabiote - Unnamed Road
description: Esplanade, quite flat and large, below the church ofSsanPpedro deSsabiote and very close to the Sabiote castle. With magnificent views over the fields of Sabiote full of olive trees and farmhouses. Very quiet for the night, camping car can be left throughout the day.

title: (23478) - 112 Diseminado Extrarradio
description: Parking without overnight problems. Not particularly beautiful and close to the road, but with other virtues: a restaurant next door (where game meat is eaten quite well and a menu of 13 euros more than acceptable), there are usually no people (even on weekends). weekdays or bridges, when everything is usually full until it is almost impossible to find parking in towns or recreational areas) with a garbage can and good 4g coverage; In addition, to spend the night is great, because from 23 to 8 it is very quiet. Option to consider in high season.

title: (23410) Sabiote - 24 Calle Blas Poyatos
description: New service area next to the historic center of Sabiote, 7 km from Ubeda and Baeza, world heritage cities, and 30 km from the entrance to the Cazorla, Segura y las Villas natural park. (Free electricity and water months of August and September as a welcome offer). Phone/Whatsapp -

title: (23250) Santisteban del Puerto - 29 Calle Sancho IV
title_short: (23250) Santisteban del Puerto - 29 Calle Sancho IV
description: It is one of the few flat and accessible streets that the town has.

title: (23478) Coto-Ríos - A-319
description:
El Tobazo recreational area.
Magnificent place next to the river to spend the night.
It is close to the road but it is very quiet.
The access is a bit narrow.

title: (23478) Arroyo Frío -
description: After about 1km on sometimes stony and steep dirt road (4x4 or high van necessary) arrived in a clearing in the middle of wild animals (we saw fallow deer, wild boar, a doe and a deer which bellowed for a good part of the night)

title: () - A-319
description: Picnic area next to the chiringuito. Right next to the river, perfect for swimming, dining and a source of drinking water. Difficult access for large vehicles. During the day (we were in summer) it was crowded, but at night we were alone.

title: (23311) Santo Tomé -
description: Good fallback spot in case of abundant world on the surrounding spots. Small corner by the river to cool off and relax. Access all vehicles.

name: Área Recreativa Los Rodeos
title: (23478) Área Recreativa Los Rodeos
description: Picnic area, very quiet, with several rivers on the sides, a park for children.

title: (23478) Loma de María Ángela -
description: It is not an incredible place, but given the situation that they have put paid parking and that at the entrance of the borosa it is already only for the disabled... it is an option to sleep peacefully listening to the water even if it is one that is involved ....

title: (23460) Peal de Becerro - 5 Calle el Ferial
title_short: (23460) Peal de Becerro - 5 Calle el Ferial
description: Quiet parking at the bus station. We called the local police and they told us there was no problem staying overnight. There is a supermarket in the same square and the station bar.

name: Camping Chopera
title: (23478) Camping Chopera
description: The campsite essentially has a dense forest of poplars and pines. Good starting point for small hikes to smaller waterfalls. On the square is a mini supermarket. In the small mountain village also 2-3 restaurants. You can't leave the square before 8 a.m

title: (23478) Coto-Ríos - 2 Avenida del Segura
description: Parking area for recreation. The sandy soil. at night is not allowed, warned by a forest ranger, to be inside the natural park

name: Aparcamiento Río Borosa
title: (23311) Aparcamiento Río Borosa
description: Starting point for a leisurely hike along the Rio Borosa. The hiking trail leads on boardwalks through a narrow gorge. After that, it's a well-walked road with plenty of bathing opportunities along the route to the power station. Then there is the possibility to hike to one of the most beautiful mountain lakes in Andalusia. In the last part, the path leads through a tunnel in which the water is routed to the power plant. It is best to take a flashlight with you. There is water and the possibility of disposal on the camper place.

title: (23470) Cazorla -
description: Large pitch with a wonderful panorama over the olive groves. Not far from Cazorla. Pretty quiet despite the nearby road. 11 comfortable pitches marked on the wall.

title: (23250) Santisteban del Puerto - km 51.300 A-312
description: Quiet and clean place, with a little noise from the road that passes by. With a playground, a restaurant that is only open for meals and some dinosaur footprints to visit. We spent one night and we were very good

title: (23476) Cazorla - 31 A-319
description: Motorhome parking. easy access. asphalted. some slope.

title: (23470) Cazorla - 67 Calle Martínez Falero
description: Very quiet cordon parking and good views. 5 or 6 places flat, rest pending.

title: (23478) Coto Ríos - A-319
description: Nice parking and next to trees, very large picnic area and a lot of tranquility. Several posters prohibit overnight stays.

title: () Tranco -
description: Camping area controlled cherry fountain. In total there are three along the Sierra de Cazorla. road on the right before reaching the puddle of oil. There is a fountain, tables, garbage, a lot of shade. The door is closed so that the animals do not enter and destroy it but without a lock. when you camp you have to always leave it closed. The foresters passed and greeted us.

title: (23470) Cazorla - Calle B Sector 5
description: Parking in the town of La Iruela. Very close to Cazorla. Easily accessible.

title: (23320) Torreperogil - Cañada Real El Paso
description: Recreational area Labyrinth of the Step. We do not spend the night but there is room for about four motor homes. Access from Torreperojil to Úbeda by Cañada Real. The parking area and possible overnight stay would be outside the Canada. Area with barbecue, tables and fountain, with little flow and possibility of filling if 30m of hose is available. Tranquility surrounded by olive trees.

title: (23476) La Iruela - 9 Calle Quebrada
description: Unused road on the road that leads from La Iruela to the sports center. Flat platform and quiet at night. Good prospects. There is another similar spot in the curve above.

title: (23320) Torreperogil - Cañada Real El Paso
description: Stone bollard with push tap

title: (23476) Cazorla - 40 Calle Quebrada
description: Plain with incredible views and quiet

title: (23478) Arroyo Frío -
description: Paid motorhome parking with gray and black emptying service and water filling, animals accepted, free Wi-Fi, etc. 20€/24h

name: Camping Llanos de Arance
title: (23478) Camping Llanos de Arance
description: With space for vans/caravans, tents and even wooden cabins. Woodlots. Clean and spacious showers. Bar with fireplace and with some tapas / dishes to choose from. With 3G although limited, and with Wifi. At night you hear a lot of animals. Near the routes by which you can leave the campsite directly.

title: (23470) Cazorla - 1 Calle Alcalde Jorquera de la Hoz
title_short: (23470) Cazorla - 1 Calle Alcalde Jorquera de la Hoz
description: It is a dirt car park with a slight slope, but, at least for me, it is unimportant. It is located in the heart of the city and only a 600m walk from the town hall square.

address.street: 1 Calle Alcalde Jorquera de la Hoz

title: (23320) Torreperogil -
description: Rest area near the country road, there is shade from some trees, picnic tables and it is level. The only downside is the noise of cars passing by.

title: (23470) Cazorla - Calle Esperilla Alta
description: Parking of the hermitage of the Virgen de la Cabeza, flat, without shade but very quiet, wonderful to visit this place, it is the start of a hiking route, it is also a must to see the magnificent views of Cazorla from such a high point it has a small source of drinking water and although the hermitage has toilets they were closed. Night forbidden.

title: (23470) La Iruela - 28 Avenida del Guadalquivir
description: Beautiful place to spend the day and admire the course of the river, it is the starting point of some hiking trails, the place is very quiet and you can see animals that come down to drink, there is a park nearby with tables of picnic and the village is next door wonderful place please keep it clean. Overnight stay is prohibited in the entire town.

title: (23460) Peal de Becerro -
description:
Just outside a chapel.
Quiet out of sight, view of the olive groves

name: Camping Fuente de La Pascuala
title: (23478) Camping Fuente de La Pascuala
description: Camping Fuente de La Pascuala - with pool and a river next door. Very quiet and with good service. Pets allowed. We stayed for one night. 21 Euro van with 2 persons and 2 dogs.

title: (23470) Cazorla - Avenida Cronista Lorenzo Polaino
description: Parking just 300 meters from the tourist center of the Villa area. The parking lot is large but further, after the bridge, there is a parking lot right on the edge of the bus stops for the city center. Don’t park Sunday night as market on Monday & stall holders arrive at 5am

title: (23470) Cazorla - Calle S 2
description: Quiet parking with views of Cazorla

title: (23470) Cazorla - 11 Calle Herrería
description: Free and quiet parking in the center of the town of Cazorla somewhat inclined. For camper maximum 5.0m. and with views of Castillo la Yedra, from here several trails begin, among others "El cerezuelo"

name: Camping Cortijo San Isicio
title: (23470) Camping Cortijo San Isicio
description: Very beautiful and wonderfully well-kept terrace campsite, especially nice pitches for small campers to 5.50 m further up, pitches are small, nice reception, small shop with regional products, sanitary very clean, always hot water, also for rinsing, 20 minutes walk to Casorla center; Access is signposted, do not follow the Navi.

title: (23479) Cazorla - A-319
description: Parking on both sides of the Guadalquivir river. Central del Utrero. Near the town of Cold Arrollo. At the foot of the road

title: (23290) Andalusia - 11 A319
description: Parking of the collado del almendral game reserve, we spent the night here, the barrier was open and there is no sign of prohibited motorhomes, very quiet place, ideal for visiting the animal reserve

title: (23270) Sorihuela del Guadalimar - A-6202
description:
Road leading in here is narrow so not sure if suitable for larger vehicles. Spent the night here 4th September 2020. Little restaurant open untill about 11pm. Quiet and peaceful. Three campers overnight. I left early in the morning. Beautiful place to picnic or eat at restaurant, great swim but water very cold. Toilets closed.

1 disabled parking space is available and a lovely lady called Lola was policing it, because of her we were able to park and spend the day, disabled access isn't great but we managed to get the wheelchair around to the chiringuito and also transfer on crutches. 

You can either eat at the Chiringuito (pizzas are great!) or take your own packed lunch and eat at the side of the river.

There are some lovely walks through the forest to a lookout point, we spent the night and Lola told us you are OK for 2 nights, any longer and the warden will have something to say!

title: (23479) Cazorla - JF-7091
description: Directly on the left side of the bridge over the Guadalquivir springing here in the near vicinity, a 1.5 km long circular path leads past a waterfall directly through a gorge. Take binoculars to the bird of prey observation. Half of the way is quite wide, the beginning of the bridge is struck in the rock with stairs.

title: (23478) La Cabañuela - Unnamed Road
description: Fantastically beautiful place along the river. This one is very broad at this point. I was here by bike but will definitely come again. Especially sun in the morning.

title: (23470) Jaén - Unnamed Road
description: You can park on the road or under the bridge. No car passed all night. Ideal for climbing or starting the via ferrata. Not suitable for caravans.

title: () Hornos - A-319
description: Huerta Vieja controlled camping area. Very quiet area with stream, fountain, tables, we were told at the tourist office in Cazorla.

title: (23460) Castillo de Toya -
description: Toya Princely Tomb Site

title: (23479) Casa El Valle - Cam. de la Huelga
title_short: (23479) Casa El Valle - Cam. de la Huelga
description:
Linarejos recreational area. It has picnic tables, bathrooms (when we were there they were closed) and what appears to be a beach bar (also closed). Quiet area, surrounded by nature and with little telephone signal (3G).
Overnight stays are not allowed, there are signs prohibiting overnight stays and camping.

name: Puente de las Herrerias
title: (23470) Puente de las Herrerias
description: Camping Puente de las Herrerías, a spectacular site surrounded by nature and very quiet ..., many activities are held for the whole family throughout the day. Quality excellent price.

title: (23470) Cazorla - JF-7092
description: Camping prohibited as in the entire reservation. Ideal to start hiking trails.

title: (23291) Jaén - 11 Lugar el Cerezuelo
description: A picnic area by the side of the road, next to a small river. 6 shaded tables and trash cans and barbecues available.

title: (23400) Úbeda - 30 Calle Risquillo Bajo
description: Self-service laundry.

title: () Hornos - A-319
description: Small mixed roadside parking near the nautical center of El tranco overlooking the dam several restaurants quiet at night length of the motorhome maximum 7.5 meters 3 places

title: () Hornos - A-319
description: Platform just after the dam. Quiet night despite the proximity of the road. Overlooking the lake.

title: (23480) Quesada, Jaén - 30 A Calle Albañiles
description: AREA IN SERVICE STATION IS NOT ALLOWED TO OBSERVE SERVICE PRICE. FREE

title: (23290) Hornos de Segura - A-319
description: Mirador on the lake and on the dam.

title: (23266) Montizón - C Real
description: Flat parking to rest on the way. Very calm....

title: (23400) Úbeda - 12 Calle Redonda de Miradores
description: Free public parking next to the center.

title: (23269) La Porrosa -
description: It is a place with shade and a cool river access is easy. there really is no one here.

title: (23400) Úbeda - 10 Calle Alcázar
description: Central car park, 50 spaces, the entrance is level but very narrow and very quiet.

title: (23400) Úbeda - 3 Calle Andalucía
description: To equip yourself with a Spanish propane gas bottle and regulator instead of a French one. Existing lyre and filter used such as. Quality help from the agency manager!

title: (23400) Úbeda - 11 Calle Don Bosco
description: Laundromat.

title: (23400) Úbeda - 38 Calle Comendador Messias
description: Drinking water source.

title: (23400) Úbeda - 84 Avenida de la Constitución
description:
Perfect parking day and night, close to the old center.
A little transient.

title: (23480) Quesada - 36 Avenida de Ubeda
description: Newly created municipal motorhome area. Nice town with all services, museum, hiking trails, bars and gas station 100m away... At the entrance of the town, beautiful views of the Sierra and Los Olivares. Pay at the tourist office where you will get a key and adapter.

name: Área de Autocaravanas Úbeda
title: (23400) Área de Autocaravanas Úbeda
description: Parking day and night. Very well maintained park with official permission to stay for maximum 48 hours with the usual restrictions on camping behavior. The rules clearly say no chairs or tables out. No cooking outside van. So please don’t!!  next door is an outdoor swimming pool. Great facilities. Lovely planting all around. 10 minute slow walk to the historic quarter. An UNESCO world heritage site teamed with Bezea 10 km away. There is a cycle path between the two. Great food and free tapas are common!

title: (23480) Quesada - 7 Plaza de la coronación
description: Quesada Tourist Office. Come visit us and we will show you all the treasures of Quesada and the Natural Park of the Sierras de Cazorla Segura and the villas.

name: Camping Cazorla Montillana
title: (23292) Camping Cazorla Montillana
description: Camping Cazorla Montillana, 3rd category. Simple but quiet and comfortable. Good pool.

title: (23480) Quesada - 4 Calle Medico Basilio Dueñas
description: Parking 24h very quiet both day and night super and doctors, next trash can museum next door an ideal town for tapas. On Fridays from 6 am to 2 pm you can not park it is a market area.

title: (23400) Úbeda - 7 Carretera Úbeda-Jaén
description: Wide set of parking lots, some dirt and others paved. It is a fairground (not currently used). It does not have services but it is quite quiet, although it is frequented by athletes and children during the day. We have met a van that has slept here for a few days and they have told us that the police do not say anything.

title: (23340) Arroyo del Ojanco - 28C Calle Carretera
description: Online parking in Arroyo del Ojanco. A town with a curious history that gives rise to its name, in addition to its typical products. Along with Mesón el Albero, where you can eat fabled, they also have a prize for the "Ruta de las Tapas", highly recommended. Good stop en route or to visit on the way to the Sierra de Cazorla, an incredible place!

title: (23400) Úbeda - C 328
description: A stop along the way, a good place to stretch your legs. It is an unused train station.

title: (23340) Arroyo del Ojanco - 162 Calle Carretera
description: Drinking water tap, without thread.

title: (23379) Segura de la Sierra - Unnamed Road
title_short: (23379) Segura de la Sierra - Unnamed Road
description: Open spot on a dead end road in the forest leading to the Embalse de Guadalmena. Some traffic by day on weekends, none during the night. No facitities or shade. Nearby, besides the N322, a cycling route on an old railway track starts.

title: (23379) Chiclana de Segura - 7 Poblado Guadalmena
description: Water tap with good flow and possibility to connect. However, we do not know if the water is drinkable. Convenient uncrowded roadside for refilling clean waters.

title: (23292) Hornos -
description: By the tracks. 4x4 needed in wet weather. Isolated spot in the middle of nature. Very close to the lake. Certainly other spots further.

title: () Hornos - Unnamed Road
description: Place in full nature totally isolated you will be quiet there is absolutely nobody

title: (23290) - JF-7047

title_short: (23289) Beas de Segura - 1 Calle Sin Nombre D

title: (23430) Rus - 3 Calle Guadalimar
description: Area in the fairgrounds very quiet place with access to electricity

title: (23340) Arroyo del Ojanco - Unnamed Road
description: Amazing spot with a view over the basin, with abroad down to the lake close by. I had a very quiet night and sun in the morning.

title: () Hornos - A-317
description: 2 parking spaces next to the Belvedere, just next to the road which is not very busy. The view is beautiful

title: (23290) Casas de Carrasco - 24 Aldea Casas Carrasco
title_short: (23290) Casas de Carrasco - 24 Aldea Casas Carrasco
description: Fountain next to the church with screw-on nozzle.

title: () Hornos - 1 Calle San Isidro
description: Parking at the entrance of the town with spectacular views. Good parking, just arrived. I ate at the Mesón right next to the pamphlet  quantity...quality ...deal...good. The fountain barely drops water.

title: (23292) Hornos - 27 Calle San Bartolomé
description: Viewpoint 500 meters before Hornos. Curved paved parking for vehicles and next to it a flat dirt platform for about 3 motorhomes.

title: (23292) Hornos - 1 Calle San Pablo
description: Parking at the exit of the town, there are 2 parking floors, in the center there is no room for a large motorhome here. We have slept calmly and with light as it was also a garage area. In 2 min in the village.

title: (23480) Quesada - Unnamed Road
description: Place in the middle of the mountain with parking for about 5 motorhomes. The access road is not very good but it can be reached without problem. Right next to it is the route "La pasa de bosque" that can be done both on foot and by bicycle.

title: (23290) - A-317
description: Large esplanade near the road but without visibility from it. In the middle of nature, without services. Suitable for all types of vehicles. ?

title: (23290) Santiago de la Espada - A-317
description: Nice place to make a stop, little traveled and accessible for large vehicles from the road. At night, spectacular starry sky. There are no services whatsoever.

title: () Quesada - A-6206
description: An amazing place right at the top of the Puerto Del Tiscar. (1180m)There are no services but there is a fuente (water source) at the closed restaurant just coming out of the village of Tiscar about 9km away. The ancient watchtower is a short walk and gives even more amazing views.

title: (23293) Segura de la Sierra - 2 Avenida Daniel Garcia Aguilar
title_short: (23293) Segura de la Sierra - 2 Avenida Daniel Garcia Aguilar
description: Land next to a school and close to the town. I parked here for the time to wait for the opening of a supermarket that is very close. I don't think there's a problem staying overnight.

title: (23220) Vilches - JH-6081
description: Haven of peace at the edge of the water reservoir of the dam. Quiet night except perhaps on weekends. Complicated access road for large motorhomes. No service outside the trash.

title: (23430) Rus -
description: A little behind a road very little used. lake view. Very quiet at night, perfect before arriving in Ubeda (30min). There are other spots along this road. Accessible van but cc surely too. No service. please leave the place clean when you leave.

title: (23440) Baeza - 20 Calle Manuel Acero
description: Parking overnight ok

title: (23440) Baeza - Calle Sierra de Segura
description: Parking arena. Quiet near the center. Shaded in summer. Garbage cans in the street. Attention market on Tuesday. Some rovers, to check ..

title: (23293) Cortijos Nuevos - 72 Carretera Orcera
description: Ample parking at the entrance of the village. Recommended to park if you want to shop within the town. Quiet place, to sleep there is movement of cars but you can spend the night without problem.

title: (23440) Baeza - 9 Calle Coca de la Piñera
title_short: (23440) Baeza - 9 Calle Coca de la Piñera
description: Good level parking space within walking distance of the center. Wall around it, but access for others possible. We have only visited the town.

title: (23440) Baeza - 8 Paseo las Murallas
description: Easy to park. You don't have to cross narrow streets to get there. The main square can be reached within a 10-minute walk

title: (23440) Baeza -
description: Baeza self-service laundry. A money changer for 5, 10, 20 notes. An electrical outlet to recharge the phone

title: (23440) Baeza - 1 Calle Jurado
description: Great place to park and visit Baeza. Entrance may seem quite difficult for longer vehicles.

title: (23291) Santiago-Pontones - Av. Sierra de Segura
description: Quiet place to spend the night, children's area

title: (23487) Huesa - A-315
description: Service Station where you can download gray water and replenish drinking water completely free. They have a small shop with snacks and soft drinks in addition to splendid views, ideal for a stop on the road, stretch your legs and charge the batteries.

title: (23485) El Almicerán -
description: Nice parking lot in the woods at the start of the walk

title: (23440) Baeza - 17 Calle Al-Bayyasi
description: Large car park near the archaeological excavations overlooking the city. 2 minutes walk from the center. possible to sleep there

title: (23350) Puente de Génave - 69 Paseo la Vicaria
title_short: (23350) Puente de Génave - 69 Paseo la Vicaria
description: Public parking on the outskirts of town, ideal for passing routes, overnight stays are not prohibited, quiet area and relatively close to green areas, it has a supermarket next door, cafeterias and bakeries area, garbage cans, parking is in flat, no shadow.

title: (23485) El Almicerán -
description: Beautiful place on the shores of the Bolera reservoir surrounded by nature. Very quiet place to spend the day and night, we were alone. In the morning we were visited by two small fallow deer. Access track a bit complicated because it is rocky and has a steep slope in some sections.

title: (23489) Quesada - 21 Tiscar
description: Perfect place to sleep near the Cueva del Agua. It is paved and quite level and has a source with super clean water from the river. The only bad thing is that there are quite a few mosquitoes.

title: (23440) Baeza - 24 Calle Miguel de Unamuno
description: laundromat

title: (23440) Baeza - s/n Calle Comunidad de Castilla y León
title_short: (23440) Baeza - s/n Calle Comunidad de Castilla y León
description: Parking in front of the Civil Guard Academy, so it is very safe to park, as well as the town itself. It is a large esplanade of land, with a supermarket opposite (Mercadona, with toilets inside) and several laundries. 15 minutes walk from the center. You can park both during the day and overnight. During the course of the guards (October / May) there are quite a few cars during the week, on weekends it is emptied. Children's play area and dirt soccer field. There are dirt roads that lead from there towards the olive groves, perfect for walking with dogs.

address.street: s/n Calle Comunidad de Castilla y León

title: (23500) Jódar - 23 Calle Felix Rodríguez de la Fuente
title_short: (23500) Jódar - 23 Calle Felix Rodríguez de la Fuente
description:
In dead end, no disturb. Ideal for lunch. Even sleep Nice view and good step to go to Cazorla or Úbeda.
Also to visit the Sierra Mágina.
In the town there are municipal swimming pools, sports center,
 many supermarkets, restaurants and bars.
You can buy virgin olive oil, incredible! What flavor!!!
In the town you can visit the castle, church, laundry and museum. Ask at the town hall.

address.street: 23 Calle Felix Rodríguez de la Fuente

title: () Hornos - A-317a
description: Ham drying workshop, where you can also empty (black and gray water) and fill the water, and spend the night for 8 euros. Natural environment and very calm

title: () Hornos - A-317a
description: A 360 ° view of the entire Sierra.

title: (23489) Tíscar - 7 Tiscar
description: Parking in the town leveled with land, in the morning the sun does not hit anything for a calmer sunrise

title: (23489) Tíscar - 7 Tiscar
description: Parking for visitors of Sanctuarium of Tiscar. No services, no shade. It is wrtten there that it is private parking of Tiscar Village not sure if it is ok to spend the night.

title: (23489) Tíscar - 7 Tiscar
description: Nice parking place above Cueva del Agua (nice to visit). Below big official parking place, there are unpaved paths under the trees.

title: (23500) Jódar - 9 Avenida de Andalucía
description: New AC area, to spend the night for free and to be able to spend a great day in Jódar visiting the town and especially the castle.

title: (23293) El Ojuelo - 20B Calle Fuente
description: Untreated water source

title: (23293) El Ojuelo - 29 Calle Almazara
description: This is a lay-by in a quiet road near a children’s park in a sleepy village with just a couple of bars. Very friendly locals said no problem parking there. No services and very little traffic. Early evening a few local kids were still at the park.

name: El Cortijillo campsite
title: (18816) El Cortijillo campsite
description: El Cortijillo campsite with restaurant. About 30 places by the river in an ideal setting. Perfect for going to various trails in the Sierra de Castril. There is no coverage, it has sloping ramps to access (we had no problem with a large and old motorhome). The worst, the access road that is a narrow and bumpy forest track, although it has sidings and with patience you can get there.

address.street: Camino de Castril a Santiago de la Espada

title: (23489) Quesada - Calle Cueva del Agua
description: Flat, unpaved esplanade, less than a km from Belerda.

name: Camping El Robledo
title: (23293) Camping El Robledo
description: Quiet place, the showers are not well prepared, a shower burns and another very cold, access is not very well indicated to enter the campsite

title: (18816) Castril - Camino de Castril a Santiago de la Espada
title_short: (18816) Castril - Camino de Castril a Santiago de la Espada
description: Place enabled as a picnic area and with wheelchair accessibility. Next to the river. We were parked by day but I don't think there is a problem at night. There are 2 portable toilets and garbage can. The river is next.

address.street: Camino de Castril a Santiago de la Espada

title: (23220) Vilches - 1 Calle Cuesta de la Piscina
title_short: (23220) Vilches - 1 Calle Cuesta de la Piscina
description: Esplanade of the fair (La Sartén), next to Parque el Huevo, good access on foot to the promenade with the viewpoint, the castle of the Virgin and caves. You can cover / eat very well in the area, next to it there is a bar called La Sarten That is covered / eats marvelous. Municipal swimming pool next to the parking lot (only open in summer with entrance fee). And many places to visit.

title: (23486) Hinojares - Unnamed Road
description: Bivouac for two or 3 × 4, calm just before the park of La Sierra Cazorla, which is prohibited at the bivouac, entry from 9h to 21h.

title: (23460) Peal de Becerro -
description: Point of view Quesada. Surrounded by nature. Tranquility and beautiful view.

title: (23379) Capellanía -
description: Beautiful place in the middle of nature, and close to a quiet road easy and flat access, please leave no trace of your passage (including toilet paper), because it is very clean and pleasant

title: (23291) Poyotello - 35 Aldea Poyotello
description: Beautiful place, start of the route to visit the water cave. Narrow access road.

title: () Pozo Alcón - A-326
description: Parking in the bowling alley restroom area. Very quiet place with picnic tables, water, garbage and restaurant

title: (18815) La Ermita - A-326
description: Large car park without prohibition. Very quiet even though the road is close. Very little traffic. Nice view of the lake and part of the dam. Trash on site.

name: Camping la Bolera
title: () Camping la Bolera
description: Camping sierra cazorla 2. Beautiful cool in summer and cold in winter with beautiful hiking trails place. Near the dam of the bowling alley. Many good restaurants nearby.

title: (18816) Castril - Camino de Castril a Santiago de la Espada
title_short: (18816) Castril - Camino de Castril a Santiago de la Espada
description: We spent the night in this viewpoint from December 31 to January 1. It does not have any services but it is super quiet and has a spectacular starry sky. Next to a dirt lane with little passage that day. We had no problem staying overnight

address.street: Camino de Castril a Santiago de la Espada

title: (23215) Aldeaquemada - J-6110
description: Very quiet corner. departure of hike / walk waterfall of cimbarra. preferable van. dirt road on 2 km.

title: (23486) Hinojares - A-6206
description: Under a big pine tree, shade assured just before the entrance of Sierra Cazorla which is closed From 9 pm to 9 am with ban of camping. 4x4 only steep access.

title: () Pozo Alcón - A-326
description: Beautiful parking space in the Hoyo de los Pinos recreational area in the Sierra del Pozo. Cazorla natural park. Very close to the bowling alley ravine where canyoning is practiced and the bowling alley reservoir. With picnic area, water, barbecues, containers, games area and restaurant

title: () Pozo Alcón - A-326
description: Parking next to the road that connects Pozoalcon and Huescar, over the Bolera reservoir Ideal place for hiking. A 5 min walk away is the restaurant of the recreational area of Bolera and Camping, which also has a restaurant.

title: (23360) La Puerta de Segura - 57 Calle Doctor Vigueras
title_short: (23360) La Puerta de Segura - 57 Calle Doctor Vigueras
description: Parking on a esplanade at the entrance of the village, it is close to the road but at night it has no traffic. Five minutes walk from the center, supermarkets, bars etc. It has no services but the town is worth visiting.

title: (23379) Segura de la Sierra -
description: Parking to climb to the top of Yelmo, an emblematic mountain in this area of the Sierra de Segura. We have slept without problem, no noise, there is no sign of prohibited overnight, but I suppose that being a Natural Park it will not be possible. Zero mosquitoes and very cool in summer.

title: (23293) El Batán -
description: Incredible viewsight all around Cazorla. take care Big Vans With Road, It is tight but problem can come from branches above, forward written in comments. Despite the antens, and a low electric motor sound there wasnt any problem for sleeping, quite opposite, very good night. little sloped for me in viewpoint, no way to level and had to do it among shelter and antenna.

title: (23700) Linares - A-312
description: Parking of the Natural Monument "El Piélago"

title: (23215) Aldeaquemada - J-6110
description: Small clearing at the top, a couple of kilometers from the Cimbarra waterfall.

title: (23520) Begíjar - Calle Alheria
description: Large tarmac car park behind the San Francisco oil mill, we spent a very quiet night there.

title: (23500) Jódar -
description: Perfect for sleeping. very beautiful view in height on the valleys and the mountains

title: (18816) Castril - A-326
description: Above the dam there is a car park at the foot of the reservoir. It is also at the foot of the road, but there is not too much traffic. It says that it cannot be circulated, although the townspeople themselves tell you that yes, that the sign is old. In the parking lot at the foot of the river, those at the campsite call your attention to spend the night and threaten to call the police, but it seems not here. No services or shade. The tunnel that is a little ahead is quite familiar.

title: (23290) Los Teatinos - JV-7045
description: Quiet place and very close to the town "la Matea" sierra de Segura.

title: (18816) Castril - A-326
description: Very nice parking and with good views. I do not know if you can stay overnight. We stopped for food and great views and very quiet. This road has almost no traffic, and although it indicates that it is prohibited, it is the traffic that everyone uses without problem. There is no shade or any type of service, from here you can walk to the reservoir, which is spectacular. By passing the tank, there is another similar parking area, with very good views and identical characteristics.

title: (23220) Vilches, Spain -
description: Recreational area and controlled camping area "La Zarzuela". In October they have closed the perimeter fence at 7:00 p.m., so you cannot enter after that time.

name: Camping Garrote Gordo
title: (23379) Camping Garrote Gordo
description: Camping in the middle of nature next to a river Walking routes through the mountains Restaurant where the mother makes home-cooked meals, some it is necessary to order them, such as lamb roasts They sell their own oil (Amurjo) Adorned with wood carvings throughout the premises

title: (18816) Castril -
description: Parking in the lower area of Castril. There is another car park next to the dogs, a little further away. You go down a steep slope that is preferable to take living from the dam. The route of the Cerrada del río Castril is highly recommended. For a guided tour of the Castle it is necessary to call and book.

title: (18816) Castril - 19 Avenida del Portillo
description: Quiet and with good views

title: (23290) La Matea - 2 Calle Ai
description: Wide area to park next to a stream. It is one of the few shaded areas, which we greatly appreciated in the heat wave of the summer. The stream is very cool and perfect to put your feet and rest of the trip. The birth of the Berral is very close and it is a magnificent walk. In addition, the Matea is a small village a a closure in the last weekend of June very fun and worth visiting.

name: Camping El Angel (Granada)
title: (18816) Camping El Angel (Granada)
description: Small campsite well located next to the Castril Gazebo and at the beginning of the Castril trail. next to the population. Large pitches with electricity and water, vegetation. Open in winter. 21 euros AC, 2 people and electricity

title: (18816) Castril - 19 Calle Nueva del Rio
description: Parking by the river, 100 m from the village, swimming pool and access to the ski slopes

title: (18816) Castril - 4 Calle Fuente del Piojo
description: Public parking. Very quiet, 5 minutes from the center of Castril and 5 minutes from the walkways of the Castril river. The overnight was perfect.

title: (23537) Bedmar - 10 Carretera Mancha Real a Cazorla
title_short: (23537) Bedmar - 10 Carretera Mancha Real a Cazorla
description: Parking in dirt but very passable with beautiful views of the mountains and olive groves. walk up about 200 m on the sidewalk and you arrive at a fountain, there you go through a park and you arrive at the main square. restaurant and shops. from there, continue up the small streets to the church and the remains of the castle. take good shoes because it climbs hard. good visit.

title: (23379) Segura de la Sierra -
description: Quiet place with beautiful views of the town, two vans fit

title: (23215) Aldeaquemada - 37 Avenida de Andalucia
description: Parking next to the village square of the village quemada no service

title: (23379) Segura de la Sierra - 5 Calle del Pintor Cerezo Moreno
title_short: (23379) Segura de la Sierra - 5 Calle del Pintor Cerezo Moreno
description: Public parking for the Arabian Baths. Mostly level. More private and secluded than the nearby car park next to the Tourist Information Office. Nice views and western facing for evening sun. Very little shade. Entrance arch may be too tight for larger units and the access road is sound but narrow because of parked cars. Lovely town and exceptional castle.

title: (23486) Hinojares - 2B Carretera de Huesa
description: Slight asphalt slope Parque infaltil

title: (23379) Segura de la Sierra - 3 Calle Cervantes
title_short: (23379) Segura de la Sierra - 3 Calle Cervantes
description: Ideal to discover the historic town of Segura de la Sierra

title: (23211) Carboneros - Camino de Valdeinfierno al Madroñal
title_short: (23211) Carboneros - Camino de Valdeinfierno al Madroñal
description: Parking dam, great view, very quiet !!

title: (23370) Orcera - 1B Calle Armada Invencible
description: Streets below the theater and pavilion of the town. They are very quiet streets and if you want something more hustle and bustle Just up the hill there is a kiosk that is very good especially in summer. There are public toilets in a public parking lot until dawn. It is also close to the monuments and shops of the town. I hope you enjoy it

title: (23379) Segura de la Sierra - JV-7032
description: At the exit of Segura la Sierra, with municipal pool facilities. Possibility of moving water if you carry bottles, very close, 25m there are old washes with water. On the slopes of the castle. Parking next to the viewpoint and two below, where are the pictures of the AC. Calm

title: (18830) Huéscar - A-4301
description: Parking to see redwoods

title: (23537) - JV-3222
description: Recreational area with ample parking (without restricting signs for the night), very quiet and clean. From the car park you have access to different routes: Torreón, Orio en Cuadros, Cueva del Agua, Río Cuadros, Adelfal and the Sanctuary of Pictures.

title: (23485) Pozo Alcón - A-326
description: Small car park next to a hermitage, a good place to visit the Enchanted Higueras Forest from here. It does not have any type of service, not even containers. More a place to go on the go than anything else.

title: (23370) Orcera -
description: Parking next to the Amurjo pool with toilets, showers and a kiosk. There is a drinking water source (the locals drink from it). A few meters away there is a restaurant, and after 1.3km you reach the town of Orcera. You can walk to the town, by the paved road up or by car on the road below. From the parking lot of the pool, you can walk or drive to the recreational area "Los Estrechos" with a picnic area, 20 minutes walk between pine trees and along the river, 4 minutes by car, it is paved. A good place to get to know Orcera and surroundings.

name: Área recreativa Cuadros
title: (23537) Área recreativa Cuadros
description: At the end of the road, picnic area and free parking in the countryside, at the edge of a stream. A little paradise with WC on site (closed off season). No barrier in height. Up to 5 or 6 camper.

title: (23530) Jimena - 703 A-320
description: A small space to park and sleep. They fit about 4 small motorhomes. in case there is no one else a large motorhome alone too. the very quiet place, you can park there for the climb to the farm cave with cave paintings, but to see it before you have to talk to the town hall to be open. you have to follow the signs for the football field, and just in front (a little abandoned) is the site. Municipal swimming pools are just where you start climbing (only in summer). We spent the night on a very quiet Saturday in November

title: () Pozo Alcón - 78 C/Atalayuela
description: Pozo Alcon Motorhome Parking located at the foot of the Sierra del Pozo in the Cazorla Natural Park. It is located in the town with all kinds of shops, services and leisure and sports activities

name: Camping El Cantonet
title: (23538) Camping El Cantonet
description: Camping El Cantonet - Warm welcome at the family campsite. Large shaded pitches. Easy to get to and well signposted. wifi and electricity. Recently renovated campsite with swimming pool and large living room with tv.

title: (18830) Huéscar - GR-9101
description: Ample parking, dream with little traffic so it is very quiet. Perfect for the night. Nice views of the reservoir.

title: (23538) Albanchez de Mágina - J-3105
description: Parking next to the Hutar recreation and leisure area, a hotel and a restaurant. With tables, sports area and fountains. Quite quiet both day and night (although on weekends and in summer with more movement). Good option as a base to visit both Albanchez and Sierra Mágina.

title: (23392) Génave -
description: RV park with beautiful views in a strategic location, next to several short and long-distance hiking trails. The last 100 m are steep in the approach. The roadway was just compacted earth, and the driveway is currently being concreted so that the square is always accessible.

title: (23550) Cabra del Santo Cristo - 7 Parque Arturo Cerdá y Rico
title_short: (23550) Cabra del Santo Cristo - 7 Parque Arturo Cerdá y Rico
description: Quiet park at the entrance of the town with fountain

title: (23486) Fontanar -
description: A large plateau with a magnificent view of the Rio Guadiana Menor. Very flat and not very stony.

title: (23392) Génave - 1 Extrarradio Diseminados
description: Upper parking of the bullring. Peaceful place.

title: (23392) Génave - Vias Verdes del Segura
description: Perfect place to relax and spend the night in absolute calm, access from the road to Genave is by a cobbled road but very suitable for driving with the ac, it is barely 300 meters

title: (23538) Albanchez de Mágina - 1 Paseo del Parque
title_short: (23538) Albanchez de Mágina - 1 Paseo del Parque
description: Albanchéz de Mágina public parking. Every day except Wednesdays from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. (market). It has a source of drinking water, it is paved and close to all the services that the town offers. Perfect area for hiking

title: (23392) - Vias Verdes del Segura
description: Area with picnic areas and parking next to the old station and greenway. About 2 km from the town of Génave and near the Castillo de la Laguna. Access by dirt road.

title: (23568) Bélmez de la Moraleda - Unnamed Road
title_short: (23568) Bélmez de la Moraleda - Unnamed Road
description: Parking of the sports center and municipal swimming pool. Accessible by road. With beautiful views of the town, the mountains and the valley. Quiet place, although the silence is not total: a transformer is heard below. The hiking trails do not start from here, but from the town itself, 4 minutes away. There are no signs of forbidden to stay overnight.

title: (23486) Pozo Alcón - Unnamed Road
description: Location for a vehicle, calm and quiet night, very nice view. No services. Please keep it clean.

title: (13750) Castellar de Santiago - 48 Calle Bailén
description: Unattended AC's area, with all payment services by bank card. Created by the Provincial Council of Ciudad Real. Located next to the bullring.

title: (23486) Fontanar -
description: Nice quiet secluded spot, easy access via gravel road

title: (13344) Torre de Juan Abad - CR-P-6142
description: Parking to a chapel 4 km from the city. Quiet and without problems. Very beautiful fountain with water tower of Juan Abad is the cradle of Quevedo. It's worth walking on its streets
